Marilyn Kent Book now View park map Park Overview Our Location Nestled right on the banks of the beautiful Tallebudgera Creek, our park is a slice of paradise. With calm, clear waters just steps from your site, it’s the perfect spot for swimming, fishing, paddle boarding, or simply relaxing on the beach. We’re perfectly positioned between Burleigh Heads and Palm Beach, so you’re never far from great cafés, restaurants, and iconic surf breaks. Whether you’re here to unwind or explore, Tallebudgera Creek Tourist Park offers the best of both worlds. One-of-a-Kind Destination Tallebudgera Creek is one of the Gold Coast's most iconic destinations. Spend your days paddling through calm waters, enjoying a beachside picnic, or strolling the scenic boardwalk. The foreshore park has everything you need - playgrounds, BBQs, picnic shelters, and plenty of space to relax with loved ones. Just across the bridge, Burleigh Head National Park awaits with rainforest trails and coastal views. During winter and spring, keep an eye out for whales cruising along the Humpback Highway. Park Facilities Tallebudgera Creek has everything you need for a comfortable and relaxing stay. Two swimming pools: One for all-ages, featuring waterslides and a splash zone, plus a kid-free pool. Tennis court: Enjoy a friendly match or practice your serve in the fresh coastal air. Playground: A large playground with soft-fall located next to the food truck, kiosk and picnic area. Kiosk: Stocking camping essentials like groceries, toiletries, ice, beach items, alcohol and barista-made coffee. Camp kitchens: Fully equipped and ready for you to whip up a meal, whether it’s a quick breakfast or a hearty dinner. Boat ramp: Located just outside the park, perfect for launching directly into Tallebudgera Creek. Local Experiences & Attractions Get up close and personal and learn about Australia's unique wildlife at Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary . Home to over 1,000 animals and set out across 27 hectares, spend the day connecting in nature. Explore the stories and traditions of the Yugambeh people with guided tours from Jellurgal Aboriginal Cultural Centre through Burleigh Head National Park. The Gold Coast hinterland isn't far. Just 45 minutes away, immerse yourself in ancient rainforests, waterfalls, and breathtaking views. Check out our must-do hikes to experience during your stay. In-Park Activities Families return to Tallebudgera Creek Tourist Park year after year - and it’s easy to see why! During holiday seasons, we host a full calendar of fun including: Movie nights Arts & crafts Live music Wildlife presentations Laser tag Stunt shows Check out our upcoming events and start planning your stay! Guest Information Activities Organised activities are offered in select periods. Information on upcoming activities is available from reception, via notice boards, guest notices and social media. Amenities Please refer to the site map for the location of amenity buildings. Hot water is available for showers, washing machines and basins. Please consider others, limit showers and help conserve water. The amenity blocks are cleaned at least twice a day and may be closed at these times. Please refer to the signs at each facility for cleaning hours, with other times as required. Children under 12 years old must be supervised by an adult. Bathrooms Accessible bathroom There are accessible bathrooms located on the southern side of the Sixth Ave block and at the Third Ave amenities. Access is with a pin code or key (deposit required) from reception. Parents’ bathroom A parents’ bathroom is located at the Third Ave amenity block. Access is with a pin code from reception. Bikes, ride-on equipment and motorised toys For the safety and enjoyment of all guests, only standard bikes and scooters are allowed to be ridden in the park during daylight hours. Road rules must be observed and a safety helmet worn at all times, as required by Queensland law. See reception staff regarding all other ride-on equipment and motorised toys, or for suggested locations to safely use these items. Boom gates Boom gates are for your security. Please follow directions and do not give your security pin to others. Cabin/Lodge/Bunkhouse Care Please report all damage, breakages and losses promptly to our park reception. We ask you to please leave the accommodation in a clean and tidy state. Rubbish should be placed neatly in bins provided (in the accommodation and throughout the park). All washing up to be done and put away clean. Additional cleaning charges and full replacement costs may apply where furniture and equipment is not left as originally found or the accommodation condition on departure is unacceptable. Guests are responsible for the safekeeping and replacement of lost keys. Camp kitchen and barbeques The park map indicates location of the camp kitchen and barbeques. Please respect others, clean up after use and remove only your food from the fridge. Do not place water bottles or ice in the freezer or cooler bags in the fridge. Alcohol and medications are not allowed in the camp fridges and the camp kitchens are smoke-free environments. Check-in time Sites – 11am Ensuites – 12pm Cabins & Lodges – 2pm Check-out time 10am Occupancy after this time will be charged as an additional day. Late check outs – depend on availability. See reception for fees and availability. Site fees are calculated until 10am on the day of departure. If your travel arrangements are inconvenienced by these times, please contact reception to make alternative arrangements. Chemical dump point There are two chemical dump points located in the park – one outside the Third Ave amenities and the other on Acacia Ave. Refer to the park map for exact locations. Dumping of toilet waste in any other area of the park is strictly prohibited. Children Supervising children is vital for their safety and helps make sure they do not disturb other guests. Children under 12 years old must be accompanied by an adult when visiting the amenities and all other park facilities. Conditions of entry As part of the conditions of entry to our park, guests are to abide by Park Rules. These are available from reception or on our website Park Rules page. Customer feedback We hope you enjoy your stay and welcome your feedback which helps us continue to improve our service and facilities. Please share your experience with others by leaving a review on Tripadvisor or Google . Evacuation procedures In an emergency, follow the directions of staff. If we need to evacuate the park make your way directly to our evacuation area – marked ‘Assembly area’ on the map. Fees Fees must be paid in advance. Your unique boom gate code is for one vehicle only. Access is controlled by an Anti-Passback system and is subject to fees paid in advance. Garbage/litter Please help us look after our environment by using the rubbish and recycling bins located throughout the park for your convenience. Wrap all garbage prior to disposal. Gas refills Swap and Go is available at the kiosk. Information For local information, where to eat, activities, events, how to get around and service providers ask our friendly staff in reception. Items for hire See reception for information on items available for hire, including tennis racquets and go-karts. Enquire with staff about local hire companies for other items if required. Kiosk Open daily 7am – 7pm. Closed Christmas day. The kiosk stocks a variety of items including toiletries, milk, bread, ice, alcohol, papers, lollies, cold drinks, ice creams, bait, beach items, etc. Fresh ground coffee – latte / flat white / cappuccino / hot chocolate, and a range of tea – with soy milk options Laundry There are coin-operated machines and dryers in the main amenity blocks. They take $1 coins – change and washing powder is available from reception. Irons and ironing boards are free. Collect clothes from washing lines when dry and remove washing from machines when cycle finishes. Washing dishes is not permitted in the laundry, sinks are available at the camp kitchen and barbeque area. Lost and found Report lost or found items immediately to reception. Mail Mail will be held in reception for current guests or by prior arrangement. Noise Quiet time is between 9pm to 8am. Consider your neighbours by keeping the volume down on radios, televisions and social gatherings. Excessive noise or abusive language will not be tolerated and can result in guests or visitors being asked to leave immediately. Personal information We are required to comply with the Information Privacy Act 2009. Any information you have supplied to us is only used for the purpose that it was collected for. We will not disclose your personal information (including confirming whether or not you are staying in the park) to any person. Should anyone wish to visit you while you are staying in the park, we recommend you contact them to advise where you are located in the park, as we will not pass on this information. Pets For the comfort and safety of guests, pets are not permitted. Placement of caravans We will help you place your caravan on your site. To comply with fire regulations, all vans MUST have the drawbar facing toward the road. Playground The children’s playground is located at the front of the park just north of reception. Smoking is not permitted within 10 metres of the equipment, as per Qld law. Children under 12 years old must be supervised by an adult. Reception Current open hours are published on our website Contact page. For emergency assistance outside office hours, please use the emergency intercom located near the reception entrance door or contact park managers on phone number 0499 611 208 . Refunds Cancellation fees apply. See reception for refund policy or view on our website Terms & Conditions page. Security We’d like your holiday to be enjoyable. Holidaying is a great time to get to know your neighbours and keep an eye out for each other’s belongings. Your security is important to us. We recommend you keep your possessions, vehicles and accommodation safely secured at all times. If you have any concerns speak to one of our friendly staff. Site cleanliness and boundaries Please keep your site tidy and use the facilities provided to dry clothes, discharge sullage water and dispose of rubbish. Make sure your caravan, car and camping equipment stay within your site boundaries. Ropes or fastenings must not be tied to trees, fences or park structures. It is your responsibility to position your camping equipment so that your vehicle fits on your site. If it doesn’t fit, it must be parked outside the park. Swimming pools Pool hours are signed at each pool area. Management reserves the right to change and amend hours as necessary for the safety of park guests. The pool is seasonally heated. For your safety and the comfort of all please note: no glass, smoking or alcohol no diving or running children under 12 years old must be supervised by an adult. Please note the lap pool is a “Kids Free” zone, except for supervised water activities. Tennis court The tennis court is located in the south-eastern corner of the park and is available for your enjoyment from 7.30am through daylight hours. Racquets are available for free hire, requiring a refundable deposit. Please visit reception to book a time on the weekly booking schedule. Children under 12 years old must be supervised by an adult. Vehicles – drive with care The safety of all guests is vital. Please adhere to the eight-kilometre speed limit (walking pace) within the park. Park roads are shared zones. Please follow all road signage and give way to pedestrians. Site fees include one vehicle only. Additional vehicles can be parked in the visitors’ car park. Speak to reception for approval and cost of an additional vehicle on site, pending availability. Water conservation Please conserve water by keeping your showers short and reporting leaking taps to our reception staff. Park Accessibility Tallebudgera Creek Accessibility Guide We are committed to ensuring every guest can have a relaxing and enjoyable stay. We aim to welcome guests with the highest level of customer service and hospitality, regardless of their individual needs. Download Tallebudgera Creek Accessibility Guide Reception and Kiosk The spacious, airconditioned reception area is accessed through a 1m wide automatic sliding door. Ample floor area within the office provides turning space for prams and wheelchairs. An alternate entry door (with handle) has a clear opening width of 770mm. The separate kiosk building and leisure area features ample sized access doors and outdoor space. Please note there is no ramp to the footpath at the front entry. An access point leading from the check-in vehicle bay is available subject to the bay being vacant. A staff member trained in First Aid is always available. Although the park is not pet friendly, service dogs are permitted with full documentation. Camp kitchen and laundry facilities Wide open pathways and a spacious camp kitchen layout make this facility accessible for guests using wheelchairs, walkers and prams. The camp kitchen is equipped with a toaster, microwave, fridge/freezer, bench height of 975mm, barbeque height of 940mm and picnic table height of 850mm with bench seats height of 500mm. An additional sheltered barbeque area located in the northern section of the Park features a fridge and picnic bench seating. Manoeuvrability is limited due to this area’s smaller space. Two large laundry blocks available within the Park are both equipped with washers, dryers, wash basins, irons and ironing boards. The entry door clear opening width is 805mm (Third Ave) and 850mm (Sixth Ave). Both have a 5mm threshold lip. Bench height is 870mm (Third Ave) and 850mm (Sixth Ave); ironing board height is 800mm (Third Ave) and 850mm (Sixth Ave). The laundry off Sixth Ave features large double doors (1800mm width, 5mm threshold lip) accessing the outdoor clothes drying area. Swimming Pools Of the Park’s two swimming pools, the larger resort pool features a fun-filled water play area for toddlers to splash around in. The descending incline into the main pool is designed to facilitate easy access for all guests. Maximum depth is 1.6m. Use of the smaller pool behind Reception is reserved for guests over 18 years of age. This smaller pool has stair access into the water with a hand rail for support. Pool depth is 900mm. Both swimming pools are heated seasonally and access is via wide open pathways. Gates for the resort pool have a clear opening width of 1.2m and gates for the Over 18’s pool 1m. 2 Bedroom Waterfront Cabin - Easy Access Boasting calm waterfront views, the 2 Bedroom Waterfront Cabin features a ramp leading to the front door and an open plan living and kitchen area. This cabin does not meet current fully accessible standards, however it does have ease of access features. Cabin Entry and Parking Parking space: 5900mm x 3600mm (tapering to 1800mm) Entry ramp: 1050mm wide Entrance door: 795mm wide Living Spaces Open plan kitchen and living area Kitchen bench and cooktop height: 900mm Balcony barbeque height: 960mm Balcony sink height: 910mm Bedroom and Bathroom Bedroom door: 670mm wide Queen bed: 650mm high Bathroom door: 800mm wide Toilet height: 440mm Hand-held showerhead, grab rails, and portable shower stool with handles Accessible Bathroom Facility One accessible bathroom is located on the southern side of the Sixth Ave block and the other at the Third Ave block. Doorway clear opening widths are 850mm and 805mm. The floor spaces measure 2.1m x 2.3m and 2.1m x 3.5m. Features include non slip vinyl flooring, hand rails, hand held flexible shower rose and a fold down bench seat. Basin height is 810mm and 740mm. Access is with a pin code or key (deposit required) from reception. Beach access and other information Beach access is via the footpath surrounding the waterfront boundary of the park overlooking Tallebudgera Creek. This level public footpath leads under the motorway to Neptune Beach. Two beach wheelchairs (WaterWheels) are available here and beach matting is rolled out every Saturday during patrol season. Refreshments are available from a café and kiosk. There are many views to soak up along this beautiful creek pathway! City of Gold Coast Mobility Maps The City’s mobility maps are designed to provide accessibility information to assist residents and visitors to plan their stay and move around the city safely. Map information includes the location of accessible toilets, change facilities, accessible car parking spaces, pathway gradients, location of kerb ramps and key buildings and services. Transport information for light rail stations, bus stops and bus routes is also featured. Printed and electronic mobility maps are now available for Broadbeach, Burleigh Heads, Surfers Paradise, Southport Central Business District (CBD) and Broadwater Parklands. Visit cityofgoldcoast.com.au/mobilitymaps for more information.
